marketNews.title: 8 Companies Ready for IPO in July 2025
marketNews.content:
The Indonesia Stock Exchange will receive eight new issuers in July 2025. This summary is arranged according to the order in which the companies will conduct their public offering and listing on the exchange:

1. Asia Pramulia (ASPR) – Producer of rigid plastic packaging such as bottles, jars, and industrial containers. Customers include Konimex, Club bottled water, Nippon Paint, Sinar Mas Agro Resources and Technology (SMAR), and Indofood Sukses Makmur (INDF). The IPO is expected to raise IDR 100.7 billion, with 46% allocated to capex for machine purchases and the remainder for working capital.

2. Pancaran Samudera Transport (PSAT) – Operates sea freight for general and special cargo, including coal, nickel, and fertilizer. Customers include PT Kideco Jaya Agung and Vale Indonesia (INCO). The IPO is expected to raise IDR 200.1 billion, with 87.4% earmarked for capex to purchase two bulk carrier vessels and the rest for working capital.

3. Chandra Daya Investasi (CDIA) – A subsidiary of Chandra Asri Pacific (TPIA) together with EGCO Group (Phoenix Power). Engaged in infrastructure holding, covering energy, water, ports and storage, as well as logistics. The IPO is expected to raise IDR 2.4 trillion, with 37% for capital contribution to the logistics subsidiary and 63% for the port and storage subsidiary.

4. Indokripto Koin Semesta (COIN) – Holding company of PT Central Finansial X, which operates a futures and crypto asset exchange, and PT Kustodian Koin Indonesia, a crypto custodial service. The IPO is expected to raise IDR 220.6 billion, with approximately 85% for working capital of PT Central Finansial X and the remainder for working capital of PT Kustodian Koin Indonesia.

5. Prima Multi Usaha Indonesia (PMUI) – Distributor of XL telecommunications products, covering about 35% of XL’s regional footprint and sales. PMUI is the parent of Graha Prima Mentari (GRPM) with a 70.67% stake. The IPO is expected to raise IDR 208.8 billion, with 43% for working capital, about 29% for a loan to GRPM for expansion and debt repayment, and the remainder for land and building purchases.

6. Merry Riana Edukasi (MERI) – Holding company that oversees education subsidiaries (course and training institutions) founded by Merry Riana. Tancorp, through PT Tancorp Investama Mulia – also a shareholder of ZONE and BLES – holds 19.32% of MERI after the IPO. The IPO is expected to raise IDR 30.1 billion, allocated to: 1) roughly 65% for learning-centre lease costs, marketing, human-resource development and other expenses; and 2) the remainder for Merry Riana Event venue costs, marketing and other items.

7. Trimitra Trans Persada (BLOG) – Integrated logistics company providing land transport and warehousing services. Controlling shareholder is PT Sigmantara Alfindo, which also controls Sumber Alfaria Trijaya (AMRT). The IPO is expected to raise IDR 140.8 billion, with about 67% to finance the construction of three cold storage warehouses and the rest for the purchase of a light-truck fleet.

8. Diastika Biotekindo (CHEK) – Distributor of laboratory, pharmaceutical and medical equipment, focusing on clinical diagnostics and life-science research. The company supplies Prodia Widyahusada (PRDA). The IPO is expected to raise IDR 104.3 billion, all of which will be used as working capital.

Key Takeaway: More detailed information about each issuer and the underwriter track record can be viewed through the e-IPO feature on Stockbit (https://stockbit.com/e-ipo).

We observe that the clustering of IPOs at the same time impacts the liquidity of the IDX Composite (IHSG). In the past week, the average daily transaction value of the IHSG was only IDR 8.8 trillion, compared with an average of IDR 14 trillion per day over the previous month.

marketNews.title: Other Hot News You Need to Know
marketNews.content:
1. U.S. President Donald Trump announced that the United States and Vietnam have reached a trade agreement. Trump said the U.S. will impose a 20% tariff on imports from Vietnam and a 40% tariff on goods from other countries that are shipped through Vietnam. He also said Vietnam will remove all tariffs on U.S. imports. The tariff on Vietnamese imports is lower than the initial 46% announced in April 2025. The details of the agreement have not been released by the White House. The announcement came a few days before the tariff-negotiation deadline of 9 July 2025.

2. Indonesia’s Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said Indonesia will sign a US$34 billion memorandum of understanding on 7 July 2025 for investment and import of goods from the United States. The package includes a US$15.5 billion purchase of energy and an undisclosed amount of agricultural products. The deal is part of the tariff negotiations with the United States, where Indonesia faced a 32% tariff in April 2025. According to the U.S. Trade Representative, Indonesia enjoyed a US$17.9 billion trade surplus with the United States in 2024.

3. The Saudi Press Agency reported that Indonesia and Saudi Arabia have signed several agreements and memoranda of understanding worth about US$27 billion. Cooperation will cover private-sector projects in clean energy, petrochemicals, crude oil supply, supply-chain sustainability, and mineral resources. Reuters added that Saudi Arabia’s ACWA Power has signed an initial agreement to explore renewable-energy investment opportunities together with BPI Danantara and PT Pertamina, with potential project funding up to US$10 billion.

4. Krakatau Steel (KRAS) President Director Akbar Djohan said the company has signed a memorandum of understanding with Xiamen ITG Group Co. Ltd. and PT Dexin Steel Indonesia for the development of steel products such as slabs, hot-rolled coils, and other potential collaborations.

marketNews.title: Strategy Towards 1 Million Shares for Beginners
marketNews.content: "Reaching 1 million shares is not about getting rich, but about being consistent, disciplined and patient." – fatihbimantara (https://stockbit.com/fatihbimantara?source=0)

tickerNews.title: KRYA Receives Commitment from LABA and Other Parties to Purchase 70% of Shares
tickerNews.content: KRYA announced that Green Power Group (LABA) is one of the prospective buyers of KRYA shares, together with Rich Step International Ltd., PT EVMOTO Teknologi Indonesia, PT Huashang Investment Group, and PT Cahaya Intan Niaga. The buyers intend to acquire a total of 70% of KRYA’s shares from the current sellers, which would make them the new controlling shareholders. The transaction value has not been disclosed. In a separate information disclosure, LABA explained that the transaction aims to achieve future synergy in the renewable energy industry. The sellers are PT Bangun Karya Artha Lestari, Hok Gwan (Dharmo Budiono), Brigitta Notoatmodjo, and Pramana Budihardjo.

tickerNews.title: ADMR and CITA Inject Capital into PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry
tickerNews.content: Alamtri Minerals Indonesia (ADMR), through its subsidiary PT Alamtri Indo Aluminium (AIA), and Cita Mineral Investindo (CITA) announced capital injections into PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry of approximately IDR 947.5 billion and IDR 182.2 billion respectively via new share issuances. Existing shareholders, including Aumay Mining Pte. Ltd., also participated. In total, PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry received about IDR 1.5 trillion. After the issuance, shareholdings remain unchanged: AIA holds 65%, Aumay Mining 22.5%, and CITA 12.5%. The transaction supports the company’s development of an aluminium smelter with an initial capacity of 500,000 tonnes of ingot per year.

tickerNews.title: TOTL Reports New Contract Value of Approximately IDR 2.5 Trillion in First Half 2025
tickerNews.content: Total Bangun Persada (TOTL) Secretary Anggie S. Sidharta told Kontan that the company recorded new contract values of about IDR 2.5 trillion in the first half of 2025, representing a 24.5% year-on-year decline but equal to 49.8% of the 2025 target of IDR 5 trillion. Kontan also reported that TOTL is participating in several tenders with a pipeline of roughly IDR 12.6 trillion.

tickerNews.title: FAST Sells 15% Stake in PT Jagonya Ayam Indonesia to Shankara Fortuna Nusantara
tickerNews.content: Fast Food Indonesia (FAST) sold a 15% stake in PT Jagonya Ayam Indonesia to PT Shankara Fortuna Nusantara for IDR 54.4 billion. After the transaction, FAST’s ownership in PT Jagonya Ayam Indonesia decreased from 70% to 55%. PT Jagonya Ayam Indonesia is building an integrated chicken farm on approximately 8.6 million square meters in Banyuwangi, East Java. PT Shankara Fortuna Nusantara is owned by the daughter of Andi Syamsudin Arsyad (Haji Isam), Liana Saputri, and her husband Putra Rizky Bustaman.

tickerNews.title: PGAS Announces Joint Study with Mubadala Energy South Andaman RSC Ltd.
tickerNews.content: Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS) announced that it will conduct a joint study with Mubadala Energy South Andaman RSC Ltd. on the utilization of natural gas and the development of gas pipeline and/or LNG infrastructure in the South Andaman work area. The two parties previously signed a memorandum of understanding in October 2024 to study the Arun refinery facilities and a regasification terminal to support upstream oil and gas activities.
